article.title: Replay - Max Payne 2: The Fall of Max Payne
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: While developer Remedy has moved on to new franchises such as Control, many fans will point to Max Payne as the series that made them fall in love with the Finnish developer. The games became synonymous with the action genre in the early 2000's and Payne's bullet-time ability is still a staple used in modern titles.
Join Andrew Reiner, Brian Shea, and me as we bring the payne load up and return to one of Remedy's most underappreciated gems in Max Payne 2: The Fall of Max Payne.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full archive of the stream above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Prince of Persia is the featured game in the 553rd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Jason Guisao and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay - Prince of Persia
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: When you ask Ubisoft fans what games they'd love to see return one day, chances are that more UbiArt the Prince of Persia series falls somewhere on their list. While 2008's rendition wasn't everyone's cup of tea, the reboot is remembered for its gorgeous stylized graphics and satisfying traversal that the series is known for.
Join Andrew Reiner, new hire Jason Guisao, and me as we return to the stylish sands of 2008's Prince of Persia.

We went live earlier but you can watch the full archive of the stream above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Batman: Arkham Origins is the featured game in the 552nd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Karrington Martin and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay - Batman: Arkham Origins
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: The Batman Arkham series is widely regarded as one of the best collections of superhero games on the market today. The series' slick combat, engaging detective mode, and loving homage to what came before it made the games a must play for those who loved the Caped Crusader. While Batman: Arkham Origins doesn't quite hit the mark of the mainline trilogy, there's still plenty to love about the Christmas tale of Joker and the Bats' fateful first meeting.
Join Andrew Reiner and me as we dawn the cowl and fight not only for Bruce Wayne's life, but the fate of Gotham as well in Batman: Arkham Origins.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full archive of the stream above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Assassin's Creed Rogue is the featured game in the 551st episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Assassin's Creed Rogue
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Assassin's Creed Rogue occupies an odd space in the long-running Ubisoft franchise. The nineth best AC game retreads familiar territory to anyone who's taken up the mantle of Edward Kenway but throws in the interesting twist of hunting assassin's instead of templars.
Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we take this journey together and return to a time before the series changed into the sprawling RPG it is today.

We'll be going live at 2 p.m. CT so be sure end your week the right way and join us in the chat! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines is the featured game in the 550th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay - Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Throughout the year, publisher Paradox Interactive has been slowly lifting the curtain on Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 and getting fans excited about what's coming next in the series. But today, we're taking you back to the spooky streets of Los Angeles and showing off where the series began with the original 2004 entry.
Join Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, and me as we sharpen our fangs and dive back into Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full archive of the stream above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Spore is the featured game in the 549th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Joe Juba, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Spore
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: After the success of The Sims franchise, many wondered what the illustrious Will Wright would work on next. The answer became clear in 2005 when the legendary developer announced Spore, an ambitious creature creator/god game that saw players make new alien lifeforms and have them become the top dog on the planet and beyond.
Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, Ben Reeves, and me as we create our monstrosities and send them to the stars, live for your viewing pleasure.

We went live earlier but be sure to catch the archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: The Witcher: Enhanced Edition is the featured game in the 548th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Jeff Cork, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — The Witcher: Enhanced Edition
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: After the success of The Witcher 3 and subsequent Netflix series, Geralt and company have become icons of the industry. But back in 2007, CD Projekt Red was just getting started with The Witcher world and cutting its teeth on telling the story of this rich and darkly woven tale.
Join Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, and me as we take you back to where it all began and experience Gerlat's first appearance in the gaming landscape with The Witcher: Enhanced Edition.

We went live earlier but you catch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Halo: Reach Co-Op is the featured game in the 547th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Halo: Reach Co-Op
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: After fans finished the fight in Halo 3 and ODST, many wondered where the landmark series would go next. Three years later, they got their answer in Halo: Reach as Bungie took us back to one of most important and devastating events in the war between the humans and the Covenant. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we squad up in co-op to save the doomed planet of Reach alongside the rest of Noble Team.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full stream archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Halo 3 is the featured game in the 546th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Halo 3
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Whether it was the years of anticipation generated from one of the biggest cliff hanger endings of all-time, the excitement for a then next-generation Bungie game, or the return of the assault rifle, Halo 3 was a cultural event that few games had ever matched in 2007.

Luckily for fans of the iconic series, the prerelease hype wasn't overstated as the game's campaign was a true spectacle with a multiplayer suite that engrossed players for years to come. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we take the fight back to the Covenant and see how Halo 3 holds up 13 years later.

We went live earlier but you can watch the full archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Tomb Raider: Underworld is the featured game in the 545th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Tomb Raider: Underworld
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: When people think about Lara Croft, many either reflect on her early adventures on the PlayStation or the most recent grittier take on the iconic crypt-diver. But not to be overlooked is Crystal Dynamics' first run at the series which focused more on puzzle-solving than the brutal combat of what would follow and that includes Tomb Raider: Underworld.

Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we dive into the opening of the game and face off against not only those who would stand in Lara's way but some funny glitches and confusing level design, as well.

Due to a certain video editor's need to go on vacation, we had to prerecord this week's episode but we'll be live again in seven days. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Resident Evil 6 is the featured game in the 544th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Resident Evil 6
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Resident Evil is one of gaming's seminal franchises that's seen numerous variations over its 24-year history. Resident Evil 6 proved to be a catalyst for that change in that it not only marked the peak of the action-centric gameplay that long-time fans lamented but also pushed Capcom back to its horror roots with the following entry in the series.
Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we delve back into the bombastic terror of Resident Evil 6 and examine how it's aged now that the series has gone back to its horror origins.

We went live earlier, but you can watch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Resident Evil 6 is the featured game in the 543rd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Skate 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Yesterday, Skate fans rejoiced as EA announced the action sports series would be making a return after being away since 2010. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we get back on the board and play Skate 2 while reminiscing about what made the series so popular and where we think the franchise goes from here.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Demon's Souls is the featured game in the 542nd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Dan Tack, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Demon's Souls
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Demon's Souls is a brutally challenging PlayStation 3 game developed by From Software. Released in 2009, director Hidetaka Miyazaki took a huge risk with this game, which favored player discovery over clear communication of what should be done next, or even how to hurt an enemy. That freedom was embraced by the player base, and the formula From Software established became the foundation for an entire genre of games.

In this episode of Replay, we take a look back at this classic game, and also discuss it's future, as it will soon be re-released on PlayStation 5. Join Alex Stadnik, Dan Tack (Game Informer's "Souls" expert, and me for an hour-long dive into the opening moments of this game.

We went live earlier, but you can catch the full stream archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 is the featured game in the 541st episode of Replay and the sequel to the previous episode. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, and Joe Juba.

article.title: Replay — Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Last week, Joe Juba, Andrew Reiner, and I went on a journey with Gabriel Belmont and rediscovered what made Castlevania: Lords of Shadow so great, including its absolutely bonkers ending. We had so much fun that we decided to look past the faults of the sequel and see if we could keep the good times rolling with Lords of Shadow 2.
The results? A wacky episode filled with impressions of Muppets, musings on vampire dating simulators, and a large discussion centered on America's sweetheart: Nicholas Cage.

This week's show is prerecorded, but we'll be live and chatting with you again in a mere seven days. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow is the featured game in the 540th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, and Joe Juba.

article.title: Replay — Castlevania: Lords of Shadow
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: When people mention Castlevania, they usually think about the classic 2D adventures that spawned a completely new genre of games (well half of one, at least. I see you Metroid fans). In 2010 though, Konami wanted to buck that trend and bring its vampire-slaying franchise into a new era. Thus, Castlevania: Lords of Shadow was born. The game focused on Gabriel Belmont and his buddy Patrick Stewert Zobek as they try and save the world from the evil Lords of Shadow in the gameplay stylings of the early God of War games.
Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and me as we return to this Kojima Productions vision of the classic Castlevania franchise.

We went live earlier, but you can catch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!

description: Alan Wake is the featured game in the 539th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, and Ben Reeves.

article.title: Replay — Alan Wake
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Back in 2010, our own Andrew Reiner wrote that Remedy Entertainment and Sam Lake's psychological thriller "redefines video game storytelling." Since its release 10 years ago this week, Alan Wake has gained a cult following because of its dream-like (or nightmare-inducing) storytelling, chilling atmosphere, and memorable characters. To celebrate the game's anniversary, Reiner, Ben Reeves, and I are returning to Bright Falls to see if we can handle all the spookiness on today's new episode of Replay.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full stream archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week!
If you want more Alan Wake and Remedy, be sure to check out our interview with the game's writer Sam Lake. Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Mass Effect is the featured game in the 538th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, and Ben Reeves.

article.title: Replay — Mass Effect
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: From its exhilarating narrative, ruthless villain, and ridiculous iconic elevator rides, Mass Effect hit the ground running in 2007 and continued to bolster Bioware's reputation as the premier western RPG studio. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and me as we aspire to the status of Spectre and save the galaxy from the sinister Saren in the original Mass Effect.

We went live earlier but you can watch the full archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Assassin's Creed 2 is the featured game in the 537th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, Joe Juba and Leo Vader.

article.title: Replay — Assassin's Creed 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: It doesn't get much bigger in games than Assassin's Creed and with Valhalla in sight, we thought it fitting to look back at the title that elevated the series into the pillar of the industry it is today. Join Andrew Reiner, Leo Vader, Joe Juba, and me as we hang out with Leonardo Da Vinci and the other cool cats of Renaissance Italy and try to figure out what exactly is going on with Desmond in Assassin's Creed II.

We went live earlier, but you can watch the full archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Portal 2 is the featured game in the 536th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik and Brian Shea.

article.title: Replay — Portal 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Greetings test subject community member! We are thrilled to have you join us for an adventure through the sparkling Aperture Science laboratories for the glory of all things science! We demand encourage your participation as Andrew Reiner, Brian Shea, and I explore Portal 2 and put our differences behind us. For science. You monster.

We went live earlier, but you can catch the full stream archive above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Lost Planet: Extreme Condition is the featured game in the 535th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik, Jeff Cork, and Ben Reeves.

article.title: Replay — Lost Planet: Extreme Condition
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Back in 2007, Capcom took us into deep space in the hopes of finding a new world to settle in Lost Planet: Extreme Condition. Stop me if you've heard this one before, but when humans reached their new chilly home on E.D.N. III, it didn't exactly welcome them with open arms, or alien claws in this case. Join Jeff Cork, Ben Reeves, Andrew Reiner, and me as we flatten the Akrid scourage and try to stay alive on this frozen hellscape of a planet.

We went live earlier, but you can catch the full archive in the video above! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Final Fantasy IX is the featured game in the 534th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik and Kimberley Wallace. The roulette for this episode is another continuation of James Bond 007: Nightfire.

article.title: Replay — Final Fantasy IX
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: On a day that many thought would never come, Final Fantasy VII Remake has finally arrived. To celebrate this monumental occasion, we figured it fitting to look back at this illustrious series and play another beloved entry in Final Fantasy IX. Join Andrew Reiner, Kimberley Wallace, and me as we return to Gaia and catch up with Zidane, Vivi, and the rest of the crew in this JRPG classic.

We went live earlier but you can catch the full archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: James Bond 007: Nightfire is the featured game in the 533rd episode of Replay and a continuation of the roulette from the previous episode. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik and Brian Shea.

article.title: Replay – James Bond 007: Nightfire
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: In another universe, fans of Ian Fleming's super spy would be only a week away from James Bond's first on-screen adventure since 2015. But unfortunately, we're not in that world but we can take solace in the fact that there are plenty of other, often hilarious, video game options for people to fill their time. Enter James Bond 007: Nightfire, an original story following Pierce Brosnan's Bond as he tries to save the world from nuclear destruction. Join Andrew Reiner, Brian Shea, and me as we try to conquer not only the nefarious ne'er-do-wells of Nightfire but the control scheme as well.

We went live earlier, but you can catch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

episodeTitle: Replay: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal

description: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal is the featured game in the 532nd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik and Joe Juba. The roulette for this episode is James Bond 007: Nightfire.

external_links.title: Replay: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal
Replay: Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal

article.title: Replay — Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Just like some of the other great developers under the Sony umbrella, Insomniac has turned into a powerhouse studio that has evolved throughout its 26 years of existence. But that evolution wouldn't have been possible without the help of a furry lombax and his mechanical mate.

Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and me as we take you back to Ratchet & Clank: Up Your Arsenal and discuss why a certain executive editor has stated that Insomniac's series can go toe-to-toe with a Nintendo giant. You'll also want to stick around until the end of the episode, where we Roulette our way into the zany antics of Britain's greatest super-spy.

This week's show had to be prerecorded, but we'll be back next week for more. If you're wanting some live content, though, be sure to check out our community stream where we play Call of Duty: Modern Warfare with you! If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, and Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Doom 64 is the featured game in the 531st episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik and Jeff Cork. The roulette for this episode is the demo for Resident Evil 3.

article.title: Replay — Doom 64 And Resident Evil 3 Demo
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Doom Eternal is out today and fans of the series have a lot to celebrate. To keep the brutal, demon-slaying times going, we're taking you back to a time when the ritual slaughter of the denizens of hell wasn't so visceral and realistic. Join Andrew Reiner and me as we rip and tear our way through 1997's Doom 64. And due to the motion sickness experienced by all, we switch up games and Roulette into the Resident Evil 3 Demo.

We went live earlier, but you can watch the full archive above. If you can't get enough of our live shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Uncharted: Drake's Fortune is the featured game in the 530th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Uncharted: Drake's Fortune
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: For many years, Naughty Dog was known for the goofy fun of Crash Bandicoot and the sci-fi platforming of Jak and Daxter. But then in 2007, that all changed with the debut of Nathan Drake. Join Andrew Reiner and me as we do our best Indiana Jones impression and play Uncharted: Drake's Fortune live with the community.

We went live earlier, but you can still catch the full archive above. If you can't get enough Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Batman: Arkham City is the featured game in the 529th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik. This is one of the few games to get a Perfect 10.

article.title: Replay — Batman: Arkham City
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: At one point, comic book games were reserved for lackluster movie tie-ins and the occasional hidden gem. Rocksteady's Arkham series changed all that by telling a mature story centered on Bruce Wayne and company, and revolutionizing the way we play as our favorite caped crusaders. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork, and me as we explore the grimy yet glowing streets of Gotham in Batman: Arkham City.

We were live earlier, but you can still catch the full archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Half-Life 2 is the featured game in the 528th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Half-Life 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: For a younger generation, Half-Life exists only as a meme. While questions of the ever-elusive sequel have plagued the game's legacy for over a decade, there was a time not long ago where people recognized the Valve first-person shooter as one of the kings of the genre. Today on Replay, Andrew Reiner, Leo Vader, and I transport you back to that time and take a look at why Half-Life 2 set the bar so high for so long.

We'll be going live at 11:30 a.m. CT, so be sure to join us and hang out in the chat. If you're loving the streaming, stay with us because after at 4 p.m. CT, we'll be going live again playing Smash Bros. Ultimate with the community!
If you can't get enough Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Halo 2 is the featured game in the 527th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Matt Miller, Brian Shea and Alex Stadnik. The original version of the game was given a Perfect 10.

article.title: Replay — Halo 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: In Halo: Combat Evolved, Bungie proved to the world that a console first-person shooter could not only work, but could elevate the medium past what many thought possible. In Halo 2, the team refined that formula and produced one of the greatest shooters of all-time.

Join Andrew Reiner, Brian Shea, Matt Miller, and me as we revel in the swelling score from Marty O'Donnell and his amazing team, bask in the glow of the energy sword, and play one of the best multiplayer matches you'll ever lay eyes on at the end of the show.

If you liked this week's show, be sure to tune in each Friday at 2 p.m. CT for a new episode of Replay. Remember to also subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Fable is the featured game in the 526th episode of Replay. Fable Anniversary, which included the original Fable and The Lost Chapters, was chosen instead of the original. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Joe Juba and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Fable
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: At one time not long ago, Fable was synonymous with video game excellence and was a staple of Microsoft's first-party lineup. While I pray those days return soon, Fable fans such as myself still have the old games to look back on for a shot of quirky British humor, simple and fun combat, and the amazing fantasy world of Albion. Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, Ben Reeves and me as we return to Fable and rediscover what made this fantasy world so enticing.

We went live earlier today, but be sure to check out the archive of the stream above. If you can't get enough Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Condemned 2: Bloodshot is the featured game in the 525th episode of Replay.This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay — Condemned 2: Bloodshot
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Like angsty cops that will do whatever it takes to get the job done? Do you enjoy seeing grown men get the pants scared off them? Well, you're in luck because today on Replay, Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, Ben Reeves, and I will be trying to keep our composure playing one of the horror gems of the last generation in Condemned 2: Bloodshot.

We were live earlier today but be sure to check out the archive above! If you can't get enough Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Castle Crashers is the featured game in the 524th episode of Replay.This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Joe Juba and Alex Stadnik.  The roulette for this episode is Alien Hominid.

article.title: Replay – Castle Crashers
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: With the announcement of Alien Hominid Invasion, The Behemoth is back and we couldn't think of a better way to celebrate than by playing the studio's most iconic game. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, Joe Juba, and myself as we bungle our way through Castle Crasher's chaotic four-player co-op mode.

We went live earlier today, but you can still find the archive of the show above! If you can't get enough of Replay and our other shows, remember to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

episodeTitle: Replay: Doctor Hauzer (Ten Year Anniversary Special)

description: Doctor Hauzer is the featured game in the 523rd episode of Replay. This episode celebrates the ten year anniversary of Replay . This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Doctor Hauzer (Ten Year Anniversary Special)
article.author: Leo Vader
content: This upcoming Monday marks ten full years of Replay, and we can't think of a better way to celebrate than with a rarely seen 3DO title from the developers behind Overblood. Doctor Hauzer is looking like it'll be the kind of absolute mess that Replay fans have come to expect over our storied history.

We went live earlier today than usual but be sure to check out the archive of the stream above! Be sure to subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

episodeTitle: Replay: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned

description: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned is the featured game in the 522nd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves and Alex Stadnik.

external_links.title: Replay: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned
Replay: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned
Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned

article.title: Replay – Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost And Damned
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: For years, fans have been clamoring for new single-player DLC to come to Grand Theft Auto V, unfortunately to no avail. Even though this may not be exactly the remedy the GTA fan base needs, allow us to soothe some of your pain by taking you back to a time when Rockstar was releasing some of the finest DLC on the market. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and I as we take up the mantle of Johnny Klebitz of The Lost Motor Club and cause some chaos in Grand Theft Auto IV: The Lost and Damned.

If you liked this week's show, be sure to tune in each Friday at 2 p.m. CT for a new episode of Replay. Be sure to also subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen is the featured game in the 521st episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Joe Juba, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: On Replay's first episode of the new year, Andrew Reiner sits down with Joe Juba, Jeff Cork, and me to delve into the fan-requested fantasy world of Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen. This week was even more fun, though, as the community stepped up and sent in pawn IDs to aid us in our quest. Thank you to everyone who sent your fun creations in (even Meg).

We went live earlier today but be sure to check out the archive of the stream above! Be sure to subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Enjoy the show!

description: Blade is the featured game in the 520th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik. The roulette for this episode is Sudeki.

article.title: Replay – Blade
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Welcome back to Replay's first episode of 2020! We hope you all had a great holiday season and we're thrilled to be back. While it may seem like a distant memory, Blade was one of the first major properties that Marvel brought to the big screen. And with each superhero film from the early 2000's also came a painful movie tie-in game, and Blade is no exception. Join us as we take on the seedy thugs as what we think is supposed to be Wesley Snipes while also discussing the bonkers trivia from the creation of Blade 3.

After their ears and eyes stop bleeding, Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and Jeff Cork switch over to Sudeki, an original Xbox exclusive RPG with an art style that's aged considerably better than the aforementioned Marvel property.

After weeks of anticipation, we'll finally be back live next Friday at 2 p.m Central to interact with the beautiful chat and make fools of ourselves in real-time. You can also subscribe to the show over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified whenever we go live! Thanks for watching, and enjoy the show!

description: The 2019 Steam Holiday Extravaganza is the title of the 519th episode of Replay. It features four Christmas themed games; Christmas Race 2, Krampus Quest II, Operation Snowman and Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – The 2019 Steam Holiday Extravaganza
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: The holiday season. A joyous time of year where friends and family congregate to be together, slay hoards of snowmen, and save Krampus from a group of treacherous elves. Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, Jeff Cork, and I as we play through some of the most random holiday Steam games we could get our hands on.

And with that, Replay is done for the year. Thank you so much to everyone who's supported the show throughout the years. From the diehards who are with us every week in the chat to the people who've only tuned in once, you guys make this show special and we are so excited for another year of making ridiculous content for you.

Next week we'll be back on the regular Friday schedule at 2 p.m. Central. You can also subscribe to the show over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified whenever we go live! Thanks for watching, and happy holidays!

episodeTitle: Replay: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

description: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic is the featured game in the 518th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Alex Stadnik.

external_links.title: Replay: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
Replay: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

article.title: Replay – Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Ladies and gentlemen, with the recent releases of The Mandalorian, Jedi: Fallen Order, and now The Rise of Skywalker, we are fully in the midst of Star Wars season. To celebrate the cosmic fun, Andrew Reiner and the gang take you back to one of the greatest Star Wars games ever created in Knights of the Old Republic.

We'll be back next week with another prerecorded episode for the holidays. You can also subscribe to the show over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified whenever we go live! Thanks for watching, and enjoy the show!

description: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion is the featured game in the 517th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Joe Juba, Nick Straub, and Alex Stadnik.

external_links.title: Replay: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
Replay: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

article.title: Replay – The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: With the buzz of last night's Xbox Series X announcement, we thought it fitting to bring you back to one of the games that put the Xbox 360 on the map: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

Naturally, we also found it fitting to play it on a PlayStation 3 for some reason. Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, intern Nick Straub, and me as we bumble around Tamriel, recreate your favorite scenes from The Fugitive, and try our best to cause as much chaos as possible.

Thanks again for your patience. We hope to go live next week for another episode of Replay at 2 PM Central. Until then, be sure to subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live next!

description: Metal Wolf Chaos XD is the featured game in the 516th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Joe Juba, Jeff Cork, and Alex Stadnik. The roulette for this episode is Fracture.

article.title: Replay – Metal Wolf Chaos XD
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Allow us to take you back. Back to a simpler time. A time where mechs walked American soil and protected the country from threats domestic and foreign. A time where From Software had yet to light a bonfire. On this week's episode of Replay, Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Jeff Cork take you back to the campy classic that is Metal Wolf Chaos XD. Later in the episode, the chat decides it's seen enough and roulettes its way into Fracture from Lucasarts.

We were live earlier today but be sure to check out the stream archive above. You can also subscribe to the show over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified whenever we go live! Thanks for watching and enjoy the show!

episodeTitle: Replay: Brütal Legend and The Turkey of Christmas Past

description: Brütal Legend and The Turkey of Christmas Past are the featured games in the 515th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Hanson, Dan Tack, and Alex Stadnik.

external_links.title: Replay: Brütal Legend and The Turkey of Christmas Past
Replay: Brütal Legend and The Turkey of Christmas Past

article.title: Replay – Brütal Legend and The Turkey of Christmas Past
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: Still craving a wholesome helping of turkey after the holiday? Prefer Black Sabbath over Black Friday? Well, you're in for a treat this week.

First up on Replay, Andrew Reiner and the gang bring you a holiday classic in the gaming stylings of The Turkey of Christmas Past. Staring Tom de Cat, our furry friend must face off against his ferocious feathered foes before they ruin Christmas.
Later, we dive into Double Fine's underappreciated gem, Brütal Legend, and blast our way through its timeless metal hellscape while slaying every demon in sight.

If you liked this week's episode, be sure to tune in each Friday at 2 PM Central for a live broadcast of Replay. Be sure to also subscribe on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Thanks and enjoy the show!

description: Silent Hill: Downpour is the featured game in the 514th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and Brian Shea, Dan Tack, and Alex Stadnik. This is a continuation of an episode from two weeks ago.

article.title: Replay – Silent Hill: Downpour Part 2
article.author: Alex Stadnik
content: While Silent Hill: Downpour may not be the most beloved entry in the franchise, it's sure struck a chord with our audience. Join us this week as we continue our trek through fog, spooky screaming ladies, wild pizza toppings, and even more fog. Also, be sure to check out part one of the series as well.

We went live earlier today but be sure to check out the archive of the stream above! Subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Enjoy the show!

episodeTitle: Replay: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed

description: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed is the featured game in the 513th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves and Leo Vader.

external_links.title: Replay: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed
Replay: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed

article.title: Replay – Star Wars: The Force Unleashed
article.author: Leo Vader
content: Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order releases today, so it felt like the right time to revisit a beloved Star Wars title from the last generation with The Force Unleashed. Enjoy the archive of our livestream above as we revisit Starkiller's dark and no-longer-canon origin story.
Replay starts at 2 PM Central every Friday, and you can subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified whenever we go live! Enjoy the show!

description: Silent Hill: Downpour is the featured game in the 512th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Bulbasaur, Brian Shea, Dan Tack, and Alex Stadnik.

article.title: Replay – Silent Hill: Downpour
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Watch the Game Informer crew explore a spooky town filled with lots of fog and maybe a few dogs in this look back at Konami's classic horror series. Silent Hill: Downpour is the eighth game in this highly adored franchise and was developed by Vatra Games, a studio that only made two games: this one and the miserable Rush'n Attack: Ex-Patriot. Downpour received a decent 7 out of 10 rating from Game Informer, and we'll see how well that rating and the game hold up today.

We went live a bit earlier, so please join us with the archived version above. Subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live each week! Enjoy the show!

description: Bayonetta is the featured game in the 511th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Brian Shea, Joe Juba, and Leo Vader.

article.title: Replay – Bayonetta
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: In celebration of Bayonetta's 10-year anniversary, we're taking a look back at this stylish-action game, which is every bit as bonkers, over-the-top, and fun as we remember. This series, which will soon be welcoming a third entry exclusively on Switch, is created by Platinum Games under the supervision of Hideki Kamiya, one of the visionaries behind Devil May Cry.

We dedicate the entire episode to this classic game, and have a nice discussion about its place in gaming and what we are hoping to see in the next chapter. Enjoy the episode, and we'll be back in seven days (hopefully live) for another look back at a game from yesteryear.

episodeTitle: Replay: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered

description: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered is the featured game in the 510th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Dan Tack, Jeff Cork, and Leo Vader. The original version received a Perfect 10.

external_links.title: Replay: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered
Replay: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered
Call of Duty : Modern Warfare Remastered

article.title: Replay – Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered
article.author: Leo Vader
content: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare releases today, a new game with the same name as an old classic. We've all just accepted it, as they knew we would. But it doesn't mean the original isn't worth revisiting! Or at least, a modern remaster of the original.

We're went live earlier with Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare, and you can watch the archive above. Subscribe over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to get notified when we go live next! Or for the game of the same name that comes out today, read Reiner's review here.

description: Alpha Protocol is the featured game in the 509th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, and Leo Vader.  This week's replay choice was in honor of Obsidian Entertainment's The Outer Worlds release the following week.

article.title: Replay – Alpha Protocol
article.author: Leo Vader
content: The Outer Worlds from Obsidian finally releases next week, but it's far from their first attempt at an expansive RPG. On today's new episode of Replay, we're revisiting one of the less remembered titles in their library with Alpha Protocol, an action RPG that's heavy on player choice.
The episode is now archived. You can watch new episodes every Friday at 2pm CT on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook!

description: Pariah is the featured game in the 508th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Dan Tack, and Ben Reeves. The roulettes for this episode are Raze's Hell and Enclave.

article.title: Replay – Pariah
article.author: Leo Vader
content: Today's live episode of Replay proved exciting but problematic. Two of the three titles we played crashed on us, which made for a scattershot but very fun stream. We kicked it off with Pariah, a forgotten shooter from the original Xbox. Reviews of the title were mixed, securing a nice 69 on Metacritic.
Enjoy the episode above! We stream Replay live every Friday at 2 PM Central, so follow us over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified when we go live next!

description: The X-Files is the featured game in the 507th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Dan Tack, and Ben Hanson. The roulette for this episode is Treasure Planet.

article.title: Replay – The X-Files
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Set roughly during the third season of The X-Files show, the 1998 PlayStation game of the same name follows FBI agent Craig Willmore as he tries to track down Fox Mulder and Dana Scully. This point-and-click adventure uses a full-motion-video technology called Virtual Cinema, which offers up a number of choices called ... wait for it ... UberVariables.

The Game Informer crew is playing through the opening moments of this forgotten gem and will do their best to not butcher X-Files legacy in the process. Enjoy the episode, and we'll see you again live in seven days!

description: Red Faction: Guerrilla is the featured game in the 506th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Dan Tack, and Brian Shea.

article.title: Replay – Red Faction Guerrilla
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Everyone likes physics, right? Physics were created by Albert Einstein, and were later purchased by developer Volition for use within the 2009 game, Red Faction: Guerrilla. In this episode of Replay, we put these physics to the test, and marvel at them for an hour straight.

I reviewed Guerrilla back in the day, giving it a 9 out of 10 rating, and raved about it's weapons. An excerpt from my review: "Remote charges allow you to sculpt explosions like an artist with an eye for urban landscaping. Singularity bombs and rockets create unpredictable (albeit awesome) messes. My favorite approach is to use a mech outfitted with jet boosters. Wildly flailing its arms through a building sends bodies and metal flying through the air. Landing the walker on a building is also quite amusing, as it often weighs more than the roofing, which results in the mech taking an express elevator to the lowest level."
Enjoy the episode and we'll see you again in just seven days with another live episode.

episodeTitle: Replay: The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword

description: The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword is the featured game in the 505th episode of Replay. It is one of several games to receive a Perfect 10. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Ben Hanson, and Joe Juba.

external_links.title: Replay: The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword
Replay: The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword
The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword

article.title: Replay – The Legend Of Zelda: Skyward Sword
article.author: Leo Vader
content: Though it certainly has its fans, The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword is considered one of the most poorly received titles in the franchise. Game Informer gave it a 10, and today we're revisiting it on a live episode of Replay to determine who was right and who was wrong, and hopefully even find out if opinions are subjective!

So, watch the episode above for a rousing hour of aimless wandering, unrestrained Groose adoration, and a baffling Ben Reeves moment that left Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Leo Vader speechless. We also discuss the hypothetical Zelda games we would make, whether or not Link should have a voice, and (for some reason) Topher Grace. It really is a very special episode, so don't miss it.
And follow us over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter, or Facebook to be notified when we go live with our next episode!

description: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is the featured game in the 504th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader. Dan Tack and Brian Shea. The roulette for this episode is Thor: God of Thunder.

article.title: Replay – X-Men Origins: Wolverine
article.author: Leo Vader
content: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is considered one of the worst superhero movies ever made, while its video game counterpart is considered one of the best licensed games of the era. Our community voted over on Twitter to have us revisit the game (thankfully) on today's live episode of Replay. X-Men Origins: Wolverine is developed by Raven Software, the same studio behind the X-Men Legends games as well as Marvel Ultimate Alliance. Raven now assists Actvision's numerous studios in the creation of the Call of Duty games.
You can watch the episode on this page above, or follow us over on YouTube, Twitch, Mixer, Twitter or Facebook to be notified when we go live next!

episodeTitle: Replay: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory

description: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory is the featured game in the 503rd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader. Dan Tack and Joe Juba.

external_links.title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory
Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory
Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory

article.title: Replay – Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: On this week's show we take a look at Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory, the third entry in the beloved stealth/action series. We go in without any tutorial, which proves to be costly early on, but once we learn how to see in the dark and punch guys in the ears, things turn around and we make progress for the first time in Replay history. We dedicate the full hour to this classic title that appeared on pretty much every system at the time, including PlayStation 2 and GameCube.
Thanks again for watching. This week's show was prerecorded, but we'll hopefully be back to the live format next week for another viewer-choice pick.

description: Aliens: Colonial Marines is the featured game in the 502nd episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader and Joe Juba. This is the first episode of the live era to have Replay Roulette with Astro Boy taking up the majority of the episode.

article.title: Replay – Aliens: Colonial Marines
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Join the Game Informer crew for a look at one of the most controversial games of all time. We're playing through the opening acts of Gearbox Software and Sega's Aliens: Colonial Marines, a game that looked great in trailers prior to release, yet ended up looking considerably different when players finally got their hands on it. We discuss this topic, and also try to find the good in this 2013 release as we try to keep the xenomorph scourge at bay.
Make sure to subscribe on Twitch and YouTube to be notified when we go live next, like we do with Replay every Friday at 2 PM Central. Thanks again for the support, everyone!

description: Friends is the stated featured game in the 501st episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader. This is the first episode after the firing of seven Game Informer staff members following restructuring of their parent company GameStop. The show serves as a tribute to these seven by highlighting top moments covering Replay, The Game Informer Show and special event such as Extra Life.

external_links.title: Friends: The One with All the Trivia

article.title: Replay – Friends: The One With All Of The Trivia
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: We already took a look at Friends: The One With All of the Trivia on a previous episode of Replay, but felt a strong desire to revisit it this week. The game was released for PlayStation 2 and PC in 2005, and features over 3,000 questions, 700 clips from the show, and is hosted by the show's Janice and Gunther.

It's one of those games that made us say "this can't be real" when it was announced back in the day, and continues to hurt our brains when we think about it existing today. Enjoy the episode, everyone. We'll be back with another live episode in just seven days! Thanks again for the support!

description: The Blair Witch Trilogy are the featured games in the 500th episode of Replay. This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Dan Tack, and Kyle Hilliard.
This episode was the last to feature Kyle Hilliard.

external_links.title: Blair Witch Volume I: Rustin Parr
Blair Witch Volume II: The Legend of Coffin Rock
Blair Witch Volume III: The Elly Kedward Tale

article.title: Replay – The Blair Witch Trilogy
article.author: Ben Reeves
content: In 1999, Haxan Films released one of the most successful independent films of all time: The Blair Witch Project. About a year later, three video game companies embarked on an epic journey to create a trilogy around the film's Lore.
Those companies were never seen from again.

Join Andrew Reiner, me, Dan Tack, and Kyle "Haunted" Hilliard (don't worry, Leo is safe – just out on a secret mission) as we take a look at these rare works of art. Will we survive the night? Will you? Will we see more of the game next week? Keep an eye on our twitter account to vote next week!

episodeTitle: Replay: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty

description: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty is the featured game in the 499th episode of Replay. This episode is the first episode of Phase 2 and began the live era of Replay. Sons Of Liberty was previously played as a roulette on Zone of the Enders and was given a Perfect 10.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Joe Juba, Leo Vader, and Kyle Hilliard.

external_links.title: Replay: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty
Replay: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty
Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty

article.title: Replay – Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty
article.author: Kyle Hilliard
content: This week's episode of Replay marks a new era for our weekly show. Replay is now live, and for the first episode we decided to play a classic as voted by you, our viewers.

We also decided to play a whole lot longer than we usually do. We played Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty for two hours, making it beyond the tanker and onto Big Shell. Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, Leo Vader, and me as we talk about why Hideo Kojima is a genius, cut to the all-important ice cam, and just generally appreciate one of our favorite games.

Let us know what you think of the new format in the comments below! And if you want to know more about what the future of Replay will look like, check out last week's episode where we laid it all out!

description: Twisted Metal: Small Brawl is the featured game in the 498th episode of Replay. This episode is the final episode of Season 5.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Hanson, Leo Vader, and Kyle Hilliard.

article.title: Replay – Twisted Metal: Small Brawl
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: This is the final episode of Replay: Season Five! This is also the final episode of Replay: Phase One! Come next week, this silly, little show will be dramatically different ... and hopefully for the better. We decided to return to the first series we ever featured in an episode of Replay to bookmark this format of the show. It's bittersweet send off, but we couldn't be more excited for what comes next.

This episode is much shorter than others, and we needed to cut it off to focus on what we're ushering in. If you are curious what that may be, watch the episode. We walk through our plans extensively, and also have a good discuss about Twisted Metal: Small Brawl in the process. Small Brawl released on November 26, 2001 for PlayStation and was developed by Incognito Entertainment. Kyle of course picks a van, but is is one series where he can be forgiven for doing that.
Enjoy the episode, and we'll see you in seven days with Replay: Phase Two!

description: Spyro: A Hero's Tail is the featured game in the 497th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features PowerSlave.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Leo Vader, and Jeff Cork.

article.title: Replay – Spyro: A Hero's Tail
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: Spyro the Dragon is a beloved character who has far too many skeletons in his closet. Following Insomniac Games' brilliant trilogy of games, the purple dragon fell on dark times, bouncing from one development house to the next, none capable of delivering the magic fans have come to expect. Spyro: A Hero's Tail is one of those failed ventures. It looks like Spyro and plays like Spyro, but the heart and soul of the adventure is missing. The flow isn't right.

A Hero's Tail is Spyro's fifth console game and was developed by Eurocom Entertainment. It released for PlayStation 2, Xbox, and GameCube on November 9, 2004. We take a look at the opening moments of the game, and then transition to another game that holds our interest more for our Roulette segment.
Enjoy the show, and we'll see you again in seven days!

description: BlackSite: Area 51 is the featured game in the 496th episode of Replay.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Leo Vader, and Jeff Cork.

article.title: Replay – BlackSite: Area 51
article.author: Ben Reeves
content: How would you start a game about aliens? Would it be with an epic set-piece where a giant alien destroys a town? A moody, claustrophobic crawl through an alien-infested labyrinth? Or would you do like Midway's BlackSite: Area 51 and feature nearly an hour of generic military shooting through brown environments? They're all good options, I guess.
Join Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, Leo Vader, and Ben Reeves as they drive through a desert looking for aliens. We certainly have a bigger reaction to the creatures than any of our in-game squadmates.

description: Castlevania: Lament of Innocence is the featured game in the 495th episode of Replay.  The episode continues from the Castlevania showcase two episodes prior.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Suriel Vazquez, Leo Vader, and Kyle Hilliard.

article.title: Replay – Castlevania: Lament Of Innocence
article.author: Kyle Hilliard
content: On a previous Castlevania-heavy episode of Replay, we played through the opening 10 minutes of Lament of Innocence and were intrigued, but didn't hit a single monster with a whip, so we decided to correct that error by returning to the game this week.

Lament of Innocence released in 2003 on PlayStation 2 and it marked Castlevania's second attempt at a 3D game after the underwhelming Nintendo 64 games (which you can watch us play here and here!). It maintains the formula Koji Igarashi established with his previous Castlevania titles, but adapts it surprisingly faithfully to a 3D setting. Join Andrew Reiner, Suriel Vazquez, and me as we explore Dracula's castle one more time, but probably not one last time.

description: Superman Returns is the featured game in the 494th episode of Replay.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Ben Reeves, Leo Vader, and video game archaeologist Frank Cifaldi .

article.title: Replay — Superman Returns
article.author: Ben Reeves
content: EA Tiburon is best known for its work on the Madden NFL series, but in 2006 the studio released Superman Returns – a tie-in game to the movie of the same name. Superman 64 gets all the heat for being the worst Superman game, but sadly Superman Returns doesn't look much better.
Join Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, Leo Vader, and special guest Frank Cifaldi as we relive Superman's open world adventure and explore the worst highway in Metropolis.

description: Castlevania: Aria Of Sorrow and Castlevania: Harmony of Dissonance are the featured games in the 493rd episode of Replay.  The roulettes for this episode are Castlevania: Circle of the Moon and Castlevania: Lament of Innocence.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Kyle Hilliard, and Suriel Vazquez.

article.title: Replay — Castlevania: Aria Of Sorrow
article.author: Suriel Vazquez
content: With the release of Koji Igarashi's Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night capturing the feel of the genre he helped create, we thought now would be a good time to revisit some of the more obscure entries in that lineage. This time, we focus mostly in the Game Boy Advance Castlevania games.
Join Andrew Reiner, Kyle Hilliard, Leo Vader, and myself as we backtrack through a number of older Castlevania games, dissect running animations, do a little voice-acting, and more.

description: Toy Story 1, 2 & 3 are the featured games in the 492nd episode of Replay.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Brian Shea, and Ben Hanson.

article.title: Replay – Toy Story 1, 2 & 3
article.author: Andrew Reiner
content: With Toy Story 4 in theaters now, we thought it would be a great time to look at how each of the first three films were represented in games. Our journey begins on the Super Nintendo with a side-scrolling look at Toy Story, transitions to Nintendo 64 for a 3D journey through Toy Story 2, and concludes on Xbox 360 with a familiar sequence from Toy Story 3. All three of these games are developed by different teams and are interesting for a variety of reasons.

This goes without saying, but we discuss all things Toy Story in this episode, and also speculate how Toy Story 4 will be. We'd love to hear your thoughts on this beloved Pixar series in the comments section below. Thanks again for your support of Replay! We'll be back again with another episode in just seven days.

description: God Of War III is the featured game in the 491st episode of Replay. The original version of the game was given a Perfect 10.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Suriel Vazquez, and Kyle Hilliard.

article.title: Replay – God Of War III
article.author: Kyle Hilliard
content: Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order is on our cover this month and it's a game that is being directed by Stig Asmussen. Before joining the Star Wars universe, Asmussen worked on another franchise that took place a long time ago when he directed God of War III.

This week on Replay Andrew Reiner, Suriel Vazquez, Leo Vader, and I try to recover from E3 by reminiscing about the final entry in the God of War trilogy and talk about its connections to Jedi: Fallen Order.

description: World of Warcraft: Classic (Beta) is the featured game in the 490th episode of Replay.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Dan Tack, and Andy McNamara.

article.title: Replay – World of Warcraft: Classic
article.author: Daniel Tack
content: Join Andy McNamara, Andrew Reiner, and Dan Tack as they party like it's 2004 with the World of Warcraft: Classic beta. Launching later this summer, WoW Classic will bring hordes of orcs and humans old and new to the original experience that redefined a genre and games as a whole. Are you going to grab 39 friends and take on Ragnaros?
For more Replay, come back to this website (or our YouTube channel) in seven days.

episodeTitle: Replay: Eat Lead: The Return of Matt Hazard

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Eat Lead: The Return of Matt Hazard

description: Eat Lead: The Return of Matt Hazard is the featured game in the 489th episode of Replay.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Leo Vader, Kyle Hilliard, and Joe Juba. The Roulette for this episode is the Xbox Live Arcade sequel Matt Hazard: Blood Bath and Beyond.
