article.title: Replay – Star Wars Rebel Assault 2
article.author: Kyle Hilliard
content: With the release of Star Wars: The Old Republic, everyone on staff has Star Wars fever. There's always a little bit of Star Wars fever going around, to be honest, but we're nearing a true epidemic. In honor of our sickness (which has kept some folks at home to recuperate on their PCs), we decided to delve into the classic Rebel Assault 2. Star Wars Rebel Assault was the first time since Return of the Jedi that actors dressed up to play Star Wars characters, and the time it was incredibly exciting.
Join Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, Matt Helgeson, annd Bryan Vore as they relive their favorite Star Wars movies and wonder, what ever happened to Chris Tucker?

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics

description: Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics is the featured game in the 100th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Prehistorik Man.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Dan Ryckert, Joe Juba, and Jeff Marchiafava.

external_links.title: Replay: Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics

Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics

article.title: Replay – Joe & Mac 2
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: I spent a lot of time as a kid wandering video stores and picking out random games I had never heard anything about. It was kind of like grabbing obscure games from the vault for Replay, and I discovered some hidden gems that way. One such game was 1993's Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics for the Super Nintendo. Considering I hadn't played it since I was nine years old, I thought I'd grab it from the vault to see if it's actually good or if my memory is clouded with nostalgia.
Watch below to see myself, Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Jeff Marchiafava revisit this prehistoric platformer.

description: SSX Tricky is the featured game in the 99th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Sentient, which received an enthusiastic response from the Replay fanbase and was highly hyped to be an upcoming Super Replay. However, comments made during the 17th episode of the OverBlood 2 Super Replay have casted doubt on the future status of Sentient as a Super Replay.
The episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Phil Kollar, Jeff Cork, and Dan Ryckert.

article.title: Replay – SSX Tricky
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: While the original SSX was one of the highlights of the Playstation 2's launch lineup, its sequel was perhaps the best in the series. With its new installment on the horizon, we thought we'd take a look back at what might be the best snowboarding game of all time.
Be sure to stick around after Tricky, as we dive into what might be one of the most disturbing (and confusing) Replay Roulettes yet...

description: The Hobbit is the featured game in the 98th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Scaler.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Jeff Cork, Tim Turi, and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – The Hobbit
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Before there was one publisher to rule them all, the Lord of the Rings license was split so different people could make games based off the books and the films. The Hobbit was Sierra's attempt to cash in on the former. Let's see how it turned out, shall we?

On this week's Replay, Tim Turi, Jeff Cork, Andrew Reiner, and I discuss our history with the Lord of the Rings books, explore the Shire, and speculate on why Gandalf was so obsessed with little people.

description: Rayman is the featured game in the 97th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Top Gun: Fire at Will. Rayman was chosen as a Replay candidate to coincide with the recent release of Rayman Origins, a favorite among Game Informer Editors.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Joe Juba on controls, Dan Ryckert on controls for the Roulette, and Ben Hanson as both guest and video editor for this episode.
rayman: Ben Hanson, a big fan of Rayman, gushes about this game the entire time, while Dan is skeptical. The game slowly impresses gameplay wise, but the whole crew is astounded by the colorful visuals. Joe is able to play well, making a fair amount of progress. Because Dan and Joe both appear on this episode, hijinks ensue. After Dan mentions Mario Party after Reiner explicitly tells him not to, he gives Joe free reign to slap Dan, something Joe does happily.
top_gun:_fire_at_will: The crew watches the lengthy opening scene that shows off the full motion video. After another scene, that actually includes Mr. Strickland from Back to the Future, the mission objective is shown. The whole crew laughs hysterically at "Avoid being killed by the ever-deadly ground", especially Joe. Not much happens, except everyone complimenting Top Gun (the movie), and Dan failing to avoid the "ever-deadly" ground.
quotes: "This is turning into the Howard Stern show," -Ben Hanson, after Joe slapped Dan.

external_links.title: List of Top Gun video games

article.title: Replay – Rayman
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Rayman Origins has been on the shelves for a bit now, and gamers (including us) seem to be loving it. Ubisoft's odd character first debuted over 15 years ago as a launch title for the PSone. On this episode of Replay, we take a look back to see if the game is as gorgeous and fun as many gamers remember it to be.
Join Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, Ben Hanson, and myself below for our Replay of Rayman.

description: "Zelda Games On CD-i" is the name of the 96th episode of Replay. Unlike most Replays, this one has two featured games in addition to the Replay Roulette, Hotel Mario. The featured games are:
Link: The Faces of Evil
Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Jeff Cork, Phil Kollar, and Kyle Hilliard. Kyle plays the featured games and Roulette.
notes: The CD-i system and games are not from the Vault; they are owned by Kyle. He bought the system and games as a gag gift for his wife whom was starting a Zelda collection.

article.title: Replay – Zelda Games On CD-i
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: With Skyward Sword about to release, it's a big weekend for the Legend of Zelda franchise. What better way to celebrate than looking back at Zelda's darkest hour?

Jeff Cork, Andrew Reiner, and I join Kyle Hilliard to mock him for owning a Philips CD-i – one of the most notoriously terrible game consoles ever released – and mock the CD-i Zelda games for existing. On this episode we look at both Link: Faces of Evil and Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon. Don't get your hopes up that we'll find something redeeming in these forgotten atrocities.

secondSegmentGames: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System

description: Max Payne is the featured game in the 95th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Metal Arms: Glitch in the System.

Max Payne was chosen as a Replay shortly after Rockstar Games showed off Max Payne 3 at the Game Informer offices. This episode is hosted by Tim Turi and features Andrew Reiner, Kyle Hilliard (on controls), and Jim Reilly in his first Replay appearance.
notes: Tim describes himself as a "huge fan" of the Max Payne franchise in this episode. He describes the Max Payne theme as "within my top ten favorite video game songs of all time" and mentions having seen the Max Payne feature film in theaters, though he admits it is a "terrible" movie.
quotes: Max Payne:
Tim (06:28): "You didn't teabag the corpse of your dead child like I did."
Tim (06:40): (speaking to Kyle) "Do you find things like this carry more emotional weight for you now [that you have a wife and child]?"
Kyle (06:45): "Uh, actually, to be honest? Yes."
Tim (06:47): "Really?"
Tim (06:49): "I can-- I can believe that. Like, I saw a horse the other day, and then I was playing Shadow of the Colossus, and... uh... when Agro fell off..."
Kyle (06:55): "I-- actually, I was just playing that part last night, and I made my wife watch it, and she was like 'why did you make me watch that scene?'"
Tim (07:01): "You should make her watch this." (laughter) "No, you shouldn't, actually..."

external_links.title: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System
Metal Arms: Glitch in the System

article.title: Replay – Max Payne
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Max Payne 3 looks incredible. We liked what we saw of the game when Rockstar brought it by the office last month, and just couldn't wait to get poor Max back in our lives. We decided to pop in this Remedy classic, shoot up some bad guys in bullet time, and reminisce on the sorry life of one of gaming's greatest sad sacks.

Join Andrew Reiner, Jim Reilly, Kyle Hilliard, and myself as we dive (slo-mo style) back into this third-person noir-style shooter. Do the the constipated facial textures and jaunty animations mar the experience, or will the delightfully overwrought monologue and unique combat win us over again?

description: X-COM: UFO Defense is the featured game in the 94th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Audiosurf.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and Jason Oestreicher.
in_this_episode: The episode begins with Phil butchering the pronunciation of Jason's last name. He corrects him, and then builds a GI Tower in Africa. As Jason explains the management aspect, Phil wonder if it will be present in 2K's FPS reimagining and Reiner confirms that it is. They research Laser Pistols, and deploy fighters after an alien ship. It out runs them twice, then lands. They outfit their crack squad of GI trained soldiers and exit the dropship to defeat the alien menace. They immediately lose a soldier, and suspect of the aliens of laughing at them and high-fiving in the fog of war. They lose another soldier once the alien's turn starts, much to Reiner's amusement. The recruits have horrible aim, unable to kill an alien just a few paces in front of them. Another soldier drops on the alien's turn, and on Jason's a soldier goes insane and finally manages to kill something. Reeves sprinkles his non-sequiter "street comedy" throughout the banter. Another soldier dies. Jason's mini-cannon fails to knock down an brick wall, much to his tactical disadvantage. They discuss the movie Blank Check and Reeves suggests throwing an alien at an alien. Another soldier dies. Phil tries to end it there, but Jason curtly tells him that he is not finished and continues with the game to kill another alien at close range. Phil then moves to Replay Roulette.
Replay Roulette is Audiosurf, and Jason plays a few songs from the Splatterhouse and Bastion OST before ending the episode.
quotes: Ben: "We'll just pretend we got them all, like the government."
Ben: "Smear yourself with alien blood and disguise yourself as an alien."

article.title: Replay – X-COM
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: If you weren't playing strategy PC games in the '90s, chances are you're most familiar with X-COM as that weird alien invasion-focused first-person shooter that BioShock 2 developer 2K Marin is working on. The pedigree for this game goes back much further and to a completely different style of gameplay. Does it still hold up today?

Please join myself, Andrew Reiner, Ben Reeves, and the newest addition to the Game Informer staff, Jason Oestreicher, in our first ever PC Replay. We look back at the original X-COM: UFO Defense and find out how long our fleshy human soldiers can last after they leave the safety of their jet.

description: Doom is the featured game in the 93rd episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Power Rangers Lightspeed Rescue.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Jeff Marchiafava.

article.title: Replay – Doom
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Doom is the grandfather of the modern shooter, originating many of the things we've come to know and love about gory first-person experiences. But does it still hold up today? Yep. The PlayStation 1 port? Maybe not as much.

Join Jeff Marchiafava, Joe Juba, Andrew Reiner, and I as we blast through a few demon-infested levels, discuss the proper coloring of explosive barrels, and try to imagine a world in which something called the "fistol" exists. Stay tuned in for the Replay Roulette where I force Joe to play the PS1 adaptation of a TV show from my childhood. Spoiler alert: He is displeased.

description: The Thing is the featured game in the 92nd episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Curse: The Eye of Isis.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Ben Reeves, Tim Turi, and Kyle Hilliard.

article.title: Replay – The Thing
article.author: Ben Reeves
content: With the recent release of The Thing, a prequel to John Carpenter's 1982 film called The Thing, we thought it was time to replay the 2002 video game sequel, also called The Thing. Are you confused as to which thing we’re talking about yet? Here’s the thing, it doesn’t really matter, because – the thing is – they are all The Thing. Are you straight on this thing, yet? If not, we can sort this thing out latter. The details are really a small thing. Just watch our thing.

Join Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, Kyle Hilliard, and Ben Reeves as they slap this thing like a cold sausage. This might be the least action filled Replay yet, but we’ll let you decide for yourself if it’s boring.

description: Super Mario 64 is the featured game in the 91st episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Mario Kart 64.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner and features Phil Kollar, Dan Ryckert, and Tim Turi. Dan and Tim play the featured game while all four play the Roulette.
notes: Despite claims made during the episode, this is not the one hundredth Replay, but the ninety-first. For this to be considered Replay 100, one would need to count all eight Super Replays released prior to this episode, plus the one-off Super Readplay gag. The actual one hundredth episode is Replay: Joe & Mac 2: Lost in the Tropics.

Dan's Bowser run was faster than Tim's by 1:42; Tim took 1:58 to reach Bowser plus another 1:27 to defeat him, and Dan took 1:19 (including the death run) to reach him and only 18 seconds to kill him. Note that Bowser is considered defeated as soon as he hits the bomb.

Reiner: "Alright, we're going to wrap this up here. Conclusion: it's still an amazing game, still really fun and Dan Ryckert is [bleep]."
Mario Kart 64:

Dan: "I think I just won escaping the stigma of being the guy who sucks at video games. I'll just go ahead and say that and assume that's how that works."
Tim: "Phil, you're beautiful."
Tim: "Yoshi's just like– he's got it worse than Max Payne and Ethan Mars combined right now. Jesus! Take my kids instead!"
Tim: "Ah, ratfink!"
Dan: "I'm just saying I get a lot of crap for being the worst guy at video games in this office, and I'm kinda kicking ass here."

article.title: Replay – Super Mario 64
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Believe it or not, this week marks our 100th episode of Replay. As such, we decided that we should feature a legendary title that we haven't revisited before. I landed on Super Mario 64, Mario's first 3D adventure and the game that helped usher in 3D gaming.
Watch below to see us explore Princess Peach's castle and go toe-to-toe with Bowser. Be sure to stick around for the Roulette game, as we picked another title that most gamers have fond memories of.

secondSegmentGames: Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth

description: The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind is the featured game in the 90th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Dan Ryckert, Tim Turi, and Ben Reeves.

article.title: Replay – The Elder Scrolls III: Mo rrowind
article.author: Ben Reeves
content: Before there were dragons terrorizing Skyrim, before the gates of Oblivion opened in Cyrodil, before adventurers braved the insanity of The Shivering Isle, there was a game called Morrowind.

Join Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, Ben Reeves, and Dan Ryckert as we get lost in the first room of Morrowind, and then take an epic journey through red fog. Be sure to stick around for the roulette to see a game that has aged surprisingly well compared to our dear Elder Scrolls III.

description: Quest 64 is the featured game in the 89th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Hybrid Heaven.

This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar and features Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and Tim Turi. Tim plays both games. This is one of the few episodes where the Roulette lasts longer than the main Replay.
notes: Both games feature dialog without voice-overs, so Tim makes up his own out loud. While everyone else is amused, Dan shows his disliking to them. Tim dies in Quest 64 due to running out of freshbread.

When they start Hybrid Heaven, they find that no one knows who picked out the game, and then claim it might be a sign for a Super Replay. One of the characters, named Johnny, is shown walking around naked in his apartment (no M-rated parts showing) in the opening cutscene which freaks Dan out and becomes an onrunning joke during the Roulette. They also laugh out loud whenever the main character Diaz goes into a rather suggestive looking crawl. While Dan doesn't like the bland enviorment of the game, he and the others get interested with Diaz shooting Johnny, the strange combat system, and the RPG elements. They end saying they'll consider whether or not Hybrid Heaven will be a Super Replay.

article.title: Replay – Quest 64
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: From Mario to Goldeneye to Zelda, the Nintendo 64 had a great variety of excellent games. One genre distinctly lacking on that platform was the RPG. This week on Replay, we take a look at Quest 64, one of the few RPGs released for the N64.

Tune in to this extra-long edition of the show to see the classic crew of Dan Ryckert, Tim Turi, Andrew Reiner, and I jump into this epic adventure. We've got dramatic voice-overs, improv singing, and a surprise Replay Roulette that very well could end up being a new fan favorite.

description: Dino Crisis 3 is the featured game in the 88th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Blinx: The Time Sweeper.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Jeff Cork, Kyle Hilliard, and Joe Juba.

article.title: Replay – Dino Crisis 3
article.author: Joe Juba
content: Do you think going to space will save you from dinosaurs? Wrong! The prehistoric thunder lizards leave Earth and reach for the stars in this bizarre action game.

Join me, Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, and Kyle Hilliard (No, not Kyle Strife) for a mind-boggling adventure that will leave you asking all of the big questions. Can switches activate other switches? How would you react if you survived a horrible accident? Who is Dino-Chris? Those mysterious and more await you is this week's installment of Replay.
Be sure to stick around for the Roulette, also. It stars one of my favorite original Xbox characters...to make fun of.

description: Halo: Combat Evolved is the featured game in the 87th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Brute Force.

This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Joe Juba, Jeff Cork, and newcomer Kyle Hilliard. After Kyle's first words on Replay (S%*#), the game begins. The whole crew is surprised at how well the first Halo holds up.
notes: When this article was first created it contained the following statement:

It's worth noting that Kyle Hilliard totally kicked everyone's ass when the gang played multiplayer Halo. It is also worth noting that Kyle Hilliard definitely did not write the previous sentence about how awesome I am he is at Halo.
Kyle later confirmed on Facebook that he was behind the edit.

article.title: Replay – Halo: Combat Evolved
article.author: Kyle Hilliard
content: This week we're playing Halo: Combat Evolved, the Xbox launch title that changed everything we know about life and planet Earth forever. That may be a bit of an exaggeration, but the original Halo did work wonders for the console first-person shooter scene. We check out the single player, shoot each other up in some multiplayer and realize that, yes, maybe the pistol was slightly overpowered.

description: Star Fox Adventures is the featured game in the 86th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Charlie's Angels.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Dan Ryckert, Tim Turi, and Joe Juba.

article.title: Replay – Star Fox Adventures
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: In celebration of Star Fox 64 3D's release, we decided to go back and play one of the series' strangest entries. Join Tim Turi, Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Dan Ryckert as they explore a world filled with dinosaurs, hairy characters, and well hidden doors and ladders. Actually, the doors and ladders are easy to see, we just didn't spend time looking for them. As always, make sure you stick around for Replay Roulette following Star Fox Adventures. Listen closely as Dan says he wants to make a Super Replay for this game. We have a rule here: Once you say that, you have to make a Super Replay. No backs! Lastly, check back tomorrow for a Replay surprise!

episodeTitle: Replay: Little Nemo: The Dream Master

description: Little Nemo: The Dream Master is the featured game in the 85th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Wall Street Kid.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Dan Ryckert, Tim Turi, and Joe Juba.

external_links.title: Replay: Little Nemo: The Dream Master
Replay: Little Nemo: The Dream Master

article.title: Replay – Little Nemo The Dream Master
article.author: Tim Turi
content: This week we dive into a less-celebrated NES Capcom classic. It's not Mega Man, Ghosts 'n Goblins, or Bionic Commando, but it's a little gem about a boy who can transform into dinosaurs by feeding them candy.

Join Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, Joe Juba, and I as we get reacquainted with some old school challenge. I'm still having nightmares about a perilous trek up a huge tree that would give the World Tree Yggdrasil an inadequacy complex.

episodeTitle: Replay: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver

description: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver is the featured game in the 84th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Heart of Darkness.
This episode is hosted by Ben Reeves, and features Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, and Tim Turi.

external_links.title: Replay: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver
Replay: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver

article.title: Replay – Legacy Of Kain: Soul Reaver
article.author: Tim Turi
content: When most people think of Crystal Dynamics, they probably think about Tomb Raider. Others may remember a series called the Legacy of Kain, which featured an offshoot featuring a soul-sucking vampire named Raziel.

Ben Reeves, Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, and I revisit this forgotten gem in this week's episode of Replay. Enjoy Ben's trademark madness as we impale, immolate, drown, and generally mess up some undead enemies. Also, stick around for a Roulette that survived the test of time surprisingly well.

description: Silent Hill is the featured game in the 83rd episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Judge Dredd.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Tim Turi, Jeff Marchiafava, and Dan Ryckert.

article.title: Replay – Silent Hill
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: While it was undoubtedly inspired by Resident Evil, Silent Hill managed to offer a completely different breed of fear than Capcom's mega-hit. Rather than relying on jump scares, Konami's series was more about instilling a constant feeling of dread. Whether it was from the suffocating fog that plagued the town or the constant static from your radio, something was always there to remind you that things weren't right. Over a decade later, we decided to pop it in to see if it could still make our skin crawl.
Watch below as Tim, Reiner, Jeff Marchiafava, and myself replay the original Silent Hill.

episodeTitle: Replay: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City

description: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is the title game for the eighty-second episode of Replay. It is one of the few games given a Perfect 10. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Looney Tunes: Back in Action.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Joe Juba, Matt Helgeson, and Jeff Cork.

external_links.title: Replay: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
Replay: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
Looney Tunes: Back in Action (video game)

article.title: Replay – Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
article.author: Ben Hanson
content: We thought that this weekend would be a good opportunity to go back and visit the modern-day classic known as Grand Theft Auto: Vice City. We were worried about how well it would hold up, but we were all looking forward to being reminded of how the story unfolds over the first couple of missions. Before long we were entering cheat codes to unlock the tank and trying to outrun the cops at a five-star wanted level. Enjoy the mayhem. Watch the video below as Andrew Reiner, Matt Helgeson, Joe Juba, and a pop-in mystery guest walk the mean streets of Vice City.
Due to a technical mishap, some of the audio from the game wasn't recorded and has been replaced by the totally radical soundtrack for the game. Enjoy.

description: Army Men 3D is the title of the eighty-first episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode was 102 Dalmations: Puppies to the Rescue.
This host of this episode was Phil Kollar and features Joe Juba, Tim Turi and Matt Helgeson.

article.title: Replay – Army Men 3D
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: The Army Men series has always had a reputation for being among the worst of the worst as one of the earliest and most blatant offenders in the realm of franchise fatigue. But just how bad was this series? We went back to 1999's Army Men 3D to find out.

Join Joe Juba, Matt Helgeson, Tim Turi, and myself in taking a look at a single entry in one of the most infamous franchises ever. There's laughter, there's singing, there's tears...alright, maybe not so many tears, but a wide variety of emotions, still.
After Army Men, Joe Juba takes the controller for what must be the fifth or sixth Spyro clone we've played on Replay Roulette. Seriously, how many of these things are there?!

description: Ecco the Dolphin is the featured game in the 80th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Aquanaut's Holiday.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and Tim Turi.

article.title: Replay – Ecco The Dolphin
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Dolphins may be amongst the world's most majestic creatures, but classic Sega Genesis title Ecco the Dolphin is far from a majestic gaming experience. Watch as resident Sega expert Tim Turi struggles to defeat this game's bizarre final boss on this week's episode of Replay.

I'm also joined this week by Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner, who get excited for a shocking Replay Roulette that fans of the Tail of the Sun Super Replay must see to believe. All in all, it's an episode of Replay that's as weird as they come, so enjoy it.

description: Mega Man 2 is the featured game in the 79th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Dog's Life.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Bryan Vore.

article.title: Replay – Mega Man 2
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Between Replay and Super Replay, we've played some incredible games. Mega Man 2 is among the very best of them. The NES title's tight gameplay, themed stages, and iconic bosses have aged beautifully, and it's always a joy to take the Blue Bomber's second outing for a spin.

Ignore the recent shenanigans going on with Capcom and join Dan Ryckert, Bryan Vore, Andrew Reiner, and myself as we take on the evil Dr. Wily once again. Which Robot Master do we take on first? How far do we make it within the constraints of an episode? Which is the best Mega Man song of all time? All these questions and more are revealed on the episode below:

description: Fester's Quest is the featured game in the 78th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Cabal.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Tim Turi, Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Fester's Quest
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: On this week's episode of Replay, Dan Ryckert and I have a score to settle with this NES game based loosely off The Addams Family. Andrew Reiner joins in to listen to our horror stories, and Tim Turi tags along to save the day when we need him most. Just like always. Don't miss this dramatic, death-filled episode!

As always, stay tuned after the main feature for a Replay Roulette featuring one of Dan's most fondly-remembered childhood games, complete with a whole bunch of unnecessary noise-making from his dumb mouth.

description: Castlevania: Bloodlines is the featured game in the 77th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features The Ooze.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Dan Ryckert.

article.title: Replay – Castlevania Bloodlines
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: The Castlevania series has a long, proud heritage, but not every game in the franchise is a highly regarded classic. Bloodlines for the Genesis isn't a completely awful game, but it's definitely not as well-remembered as other Castlevania games. This week on Replay, we decided to take a look at Bloodlines to find out why that is.
Join Tim Turi, Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and myself as we check out several levels of this tough platformer followed by a Replay Roulette that would have been better had it remained forgotten.

description: Breath of Fire is the featured game in the 76th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Rex Ronan: Experimental Surgeon.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi, and features Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and Jeff Cork.

article.title: Replay – Breath Of Fire
article.author: Tim Turi
content: A select few of the Game Informer crew have journeyed through this classic Capcom SNES RPG from 1994, but those who did remember liking it. Unfortunately, that's about all they remember. We plugged this quest starring the blue-haired hero, Ryu, into the Super Nintendo for a short ride.

Join Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, Jeff Cork, and I as we stumble through the beginning paces of the grand experience. Be sure to stay for a wildly unexpected and uncomfortably zany Replay Roulette as well.

description: Donkey Kong Country is the featured game in the 75th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features DinoCity.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Jeff Cork.

article.title: Replay – Donkey Kong Country
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Most of Nintendo's early platformers were renowned for their stellar gameplay, but Donkey Kong Country was known more for its 3D-like graphics than anything else. While it was no slouch in the gameplay department, we were more entranced by the then-impressive character models for DK and his enemies. With the novelty of the graphics behind us, how does the platforming hold up in 2011?
Watch below to see myself, Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Jeff Cork play through the SNES classic.

description: Disney's Aladdin is the featured game in the 74th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Captain America and the Avengers.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi, and features Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and Ben Reeves.

article.title: Replay – Aladdin
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Games based on movies are almost always crappy, and that's the case in 2011. Back in the 16-bit days, it was almost a certainty that they'd be terrible. However, one beloved Disney film made for a fantastic Genesis sidescroller (a slightly different version was on Super Nintendo, but we play the Genesis version on this episode). Watch below as myself, Tim Turi, Andrew Reiner, and Ben Reeves revisit the charming Aladdin.

episodeTitle: Replay: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII

description: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII is the featured game in the 73rd episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features The Adventures of Cookie & Cream.
This episode is hosted by Joe Juba, and features Tim Turi, Dan Ryckert, and Andrew Reiner.

external_links.title: Replay: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII
Replay: Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII
Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII

article.title: Replay – Dirge of Cerberus: FF VII
article.author: Joe Juba
content: Final Fantasy VII is one of the most revered RPGs in history. Since Vincent Valentine is a fan favorite character from that game, his spin-off venture should be pretty successful, right? Wrong.
Join us as we joke about keycards and fantasy cell phones, have some super-nerdy Final Fantasy discussions, and (as always) call Dan's game-playing skills into question.

description: Sonic Adventure is the name of the 72nd episode of Replay. It was posted to the Game Informer website on June 4, 2011. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Blue Stinger.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner, with Ben Hanson on video and technical duty. Dan plays both the featured game and the Roulette.

During the 17th episode of the OverBlood 2 Super Replay, it was revealed that Blue Stinger would be an upcoming Super Replay, and was planned to debut on December 31, 2012, the anniversary of the first OverBlood Super Replay.
notes: About ten minutes had to be cut out from the beginning of the Blue Stinger Roulette because of a "Dreamcast copyright-induced technical glitch."
quotes: Sonic Adventure:
Tim: "I think this is the level everyone thinks of when you mention Sonic Adventure."
Reiner: "Because it's the only level anybody played."
Tim: "I write at Game Informer Dan, I get to know this."
Tim: "Sonic in an elevator! That's what I always wanted!"
Dan: "Boring Mayan Place Zone?"
Reiner: "Well it started with Dan's orgasmic whale thing."
Blue Stinger:
Tim: "Climax Graphics, I think that's where Orgasmic Whale worked."
Tim: "This is like Uncharted 2. Just starts. Bang!"
Tim: "Look at those jeans. They're like grandpa wranglers...that'd be a weird occupation."
Dan: "This guy emotes a lot. Physically."
Tim: "Wind? Does his shirt just say wind? It's not as cool when it's not a Japanese character."
Dan: "That's the default whenever it comes out of a cutscene, just the front of his hair."
credit_cookies: Sonic's Japanese quote when he finishes a level with Tim saying "I'm a real girl" after.

article.title: Replay – Sonic Adventure
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Tossing in an old Sonic title for an episode of Replay has been a long time coming. I just never thought the first one we'd play would be Sonic Adventure. Don't get me wrong - I loved Sonic Adventure when it released alongside the Dreamcast in 1999, but that games, well... it hasn't aged so well. Not nearly as well as the Genesis titles, anyway.
Join Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and myself as we return to this console-defining title. Be sure to stick around for the bizarre Replay Roulette title.

episodeTitle: Replay: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire

description: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire is the featured game in the 71st episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features South Park.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Dan Ryckert and Tim Turi.

external_links.title: Replay: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire
Replay: Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire
Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire (video game)

article.title: Replay – Shadows Of The Empire
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Dozens of Star Wars titles have been released since the 1980s, and they've run the gamut from excellent (Knights of the Old Republic) to downright awful (Masters of Teras Kasi). Shadows of the Empire was released near the beginning of the Nintendo 64's life cycle, and it falls somewhere in between.

The opening mission on Hoth is great, and its popularity spawned the excellent Rogue Squadron games. However, its on-foot missions weren't quite as universally loved. Watch below as we revisit this middle-of-the-road Star Wars title.

description: War of the Monsters is the featured game in the 70th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Godzilla: Destroy All Monsters Melee.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner, Bryan Vore, and Jeff Cork.

article.title: Replay – War Of The Monsters
article.author: Bryan Vore
content: In celebration of the recently announced Starhawk, we decided to go back to an earlier game from many of the same developers. Incognito Entertainment made such great titles as Twisted Metal: Black and the 2007 PS3 Warhawk, but looks to have disappeared as many employees have split off to Eat Sleep Play and LightBox Interactive. Now LightBox has taken up the mantle of Starhawk, but their legacy still includes 2003 PlayStation 2 title War of the Monsters.
Watch as Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, Jeff Cork, and myself bash each other through buildings as various kooky monsters.

description: Super Smash Bros. Brawl is the featured game in the 69th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Rayman Arena.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi, and features the band Powerglove.

article.title: Replay – Smash Bros. Brawl (Guest: Powerglove)
article.author: Tim Turi
content: The Super Smash Bros. series is all about bringing together gamers who revel in beating the snot out of one another with their favorite Nintendo characters. Among the game's plethora of fans there is a group of four musicians who have engaged in many of their own Smash Bros. marathon sessions. Those four individuals make up Powerglove, a power metal band that specializes in casting Level 5 Metalaga all over the faces of metal and video game music enthusiasts alike. Their current tour recently brought them through the Twin Cities, and they were kind enough to visit the Game Informer office for a few rounds of Smash Bros. Brawl on this very special episode of Replay.

I am joined by 3/4 of Powerglove - bassist Nick Avila, guitarist Chris Marchiel, and drummer Bassil Silver (unfortunately guitarist Alex Berkson couldn't join us). Come along with us as we boot up this tasty Wii treat and chat about video games, the band, and leprosy.

description: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks is the featured game in the 68th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Mortal Kombat: Special Forces.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner and Phil Kollar.

article.title: Replay – Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Last month, the latest Mortal Kombat title released. I was skeptical that I would enjoy it, and in a shocking turn of events, Dan Ryckert of all people convinced me to give it a chance, and I ended up totally loving it. This week's episode of Replay plays out in a familiar fashion.

Dan brings Andrew Reiner and I along to check out this co-op-focused PlayStation 2 brawler that sees kombatants Liu Kang and Kung Lao take center stage. Does it hold up? Am I better at fatalities than Dan? And is the platforming actually forgivable? Watch and find out!
Stay tuned after the main program for a Replay Roulette where we look at a much darker entry in MK history.

description: Metroid Prime is the featured game in the 67th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Minority Report: Everybody Runs.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner and Dan Ryckert.

article.title: Replay – Metroid Prime
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: On this week's show, we take a look back at one of the Gamecube's best games and Nintendo's most surprising franchise reinventions.

Andrew Reiner and Dan Ryckert join me in playing through the first 20 minutes or so of Retro's at-the-time-totally-shocking first-person take on the Metroid formula. Tune in to see how well it holds up and hear plenty of reminiscing about our thoughts on this turn for the series and where we'd like to see it go next.
Oh, and stay tuned after the main show for another Replay Roulette classic.

description: EyeToy: Operation Spy is the featured game in the 66th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Fight Club.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Tim Turi and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Eyetoy Operation Spy
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: In the world of peripherals that never really caught on, the EyeToy wasn't quite as much of an embarrassment as the likes of the e-Reader, the Game Boy Printer, or WiiSpeak. However, it didn't exactly fly off store shelves or revolutionize the industry. A handful of titles were designed exclusively for EyeToy play, and Operation Spy is one of them. We didn't know quite what to expect, so we popped it in for this week's Replay.
Watch below as Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and myself take a look back at pre-Kinect camera-based gaming.

secondSegmentGames: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty (demo)

description: Zone of the Enders is the featured game in the 65th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features a demo of Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty, a game which received a Perfect 10 from Game Informer.
This episode is hosted by Andrew Reiner, and features Tim Turi, Dan Ryckert, and Joe Juba.

external_links.title: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty

article.title: Replay – Zone Of The Enders
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Many gamers picked up Konami's fast-paced mech title because of the demo of Metal Gear Solid 2 that came packaged with it. However, Zone of the Enders wound up being far more than an afterthought. With lighting-quick space battles and spectacular visuals, it became a favorite even amongst those who had no previous interest in mech games.

Check out this week's Replay, where Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, Joe Juba, and myself rediscover how awesome this game really was. Stay tuned for the Roulette, as you'll get to relive the demo that amazed us all in the early days of the Playstation 2.

secondSegmentGames: ToeJam and Earl 3: Mission to Earth

description: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell is the featured game in the 64th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features ToeJam & Earl III: Mission to Earth.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and Tim Turi.

external_links.title: ToeJam & Earl III: Mission to Earth

article.title: Replay – Splinter Cell
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Fans of this classic Tom Clancy-branded stealth series, prepare to be frustrated! On this week's episode of Replay, Dan Ryckert, Tim Turi, Andrew Reiner, and I revisit the Xbox release that started the Splinter Cell series. Unfortunately, it's been a while since we've played this game -- in the case of Dan and I, we've barely ever touched it -- so it takes a bit of time to get reacquaint ourselves with the complex control scheme. Like, uh...most of the episode.
Prepare some angry comments for Dan and stick with us for a Replay Roulette where we check out another Xbox...er...classic -- this time, with co-op!

episodeTitle: Replay: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy

mainSegmentGamesAdv.title: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy

secondSegmentGames: Friends: The One With All the Trivia

description: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy is the featured game in the 63rd episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Friends: The One With All The Trivia.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Ben Reeves.

external_links.title: Replay: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy
Replay: Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy
Jak and Daxter: The Precursor Legacy

article.title: Replay – Jak And Daxter
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Before Naughty Dog was crafting the cinematic masterpiece that is the Uncharted series on PlayStation 3, they were behind a beloved series of platformers for the PlayStation 2. On this week's edition of Replay, we take a look at the very first Jak and Daxter game and discuss our feelings on the series as a whole.

Join myself, Tim Turi, Andrew Reiner, and Ben Reeves as we grab every collectible we can find and take on an antagonistic bird. Be sure to stick around for an epic showdown between Ben and Tim in one of the longest and most infuriating Replay Roulettes yet -- for Reiner anyway. He seemed to dislike this game quite a bit.

description: Luigi's Mansion is the title game for the sixty-second episode of Replay. It was posted to the Game Informer website on The Replay Roulette is WarioWare, Inc.: Mega Party Game$!

This episode is hosted by Tim Turi, and stars Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and first-time guest Sean Lowery. It is ironic that this was Sean's first appearance, as it was also his last. To commerate his leaving, he guested on a game he enjoyed. Dan and Tim had never played the game before, and were excited to try it out. For the main game, Tim was at the controls.

Starting from the beginning, Tim has some difficulty with the strange control style. Eventually he gets the hang of it, and progresses into the mansion. The whole crew is charmed by Luigi's quirkiness, immediately enjoying the game's humor.
The game was revisted as a Super Replay later on.

article.title: Replay – Luigi's Mansion
article.author: Tim Turi
content: This week we dust off a Gamecube title that didn't receive the credit it deserved, which is basically the titular protagonist's life story. This ghost-busting launch title defined the early Gamecube experience for many gamers, and polarized its audience in the process. We brought in some Luigi's Mansion newbies and veterans to sit down and settle the debate once and for all.

Join Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and guest Sean Lowery, Game Informer's former lead programmer, as we guide Mario's green-garbed sibling through the early sections of the haunted mansion. Neither Dan Ryckert or myself had any prior experience with Luigi's Mansion before this episode, and our inexperience is a good counter balance to Reiner and Sean's misty-eyed nostalgia. Noses bounce, names are yelled, and cabinets are violated in this special episode of Replay. Stay tuned for a ludicrously fast-paced roulette.

Note: This is Sean's first and only appearance on Replay before he departs from the Game Informer staff. I'd like to take the opportunity to thank our former lead programmer for starring on this week's episode, and for fixing the website after all the times we editors busted the thing. Good luck, Sean!

description: Wild 9 is the title game of the 61st episode of Replay. It was posted to the Game Informer website on March 19, 2011.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar and features Dan Ryckert (on controls), Tim Turi, and Andrew Reiner. The article for this Replay notes that the game was a "highly-requested" Replay choice.
The Replay Roulette is Tail of the Sun, which would later be played in its entirety as a Super Replay.

article.title: Replay – Wild 9
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: While Wild 9 may not get quite as much love as other Shiny-developed games, such as Earthworm Jim and MDK, it has a cult following of its own. Tim Turi, Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and I decided to finally tackle this highly-requested game on this week's edition of Replay.

Watch as both Dan and Tim attempt to master the difficult platforming and bizarre electric whip mechanics of this PS1 release. And be sure to stick around for Replay Roulette, where Dan discovers his new favorite game of all time and is -- no joke here -- happier than I have ever seen him before.

description: Metal Warriors is the featured game in the 60th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Super Bonk.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and special guest Aram Jabbari, PR Manager for Atlus.

article.title: Replay – Metal Warriors (Guest: Aram Jabbari)
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Atlus is known for bringing quirky Japanese titles like Persona and Demon's Souls to the states. Aram Jabbari, Atlus' manager of public relations, has a similar eye for overlooked gems. Aram recently swung by the Game Informer offices, and we invited him to select any game he wanted for a special episode of Replay. His selection was Metal Warriors, a childhood favorite from LucasArts for the SNES.

Join special guest Aram Jabbari, Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and I as we plug in this under-appreciated treasure. We go head to head in frenetic mech battles, I try my hand at the action-packed single-player, and Aram shares his fond memories for the game. Stick around for the Replay Roulette. It still has my head spinning.

description: RoboCop is the featured game in the 59th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Dinotopia.
This episode is hosted by Phil Kollar, and features Joe Juba, Dan Ryckert, and Andrew Reiner.
This episode was later given its own replay in Replay: Replay.

article.title: Replay – Robocop
article.author: Phil Kollar
content: Freeze, punk! On this week's episode of Replay, I'm joined by Robocop fans Joe Juba, Andrew Reiner, and Dan Ryckert to check out an Xbox interpretation of the classic film franchise. This atrocity was created in 2003 by none other than Titus Software -- the same dastardly developers behind the notoriously awful Superman 64.
Tune in for further examples of why Dan sucks at video games as well as some hilariously over-sized rodents. Also stick with us for the most off-topic Replay Roulette ever.

description: Duke Nukem 3D is the featured game in the 58th episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode features Fade to Black.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert, and features Andrew Reiner and special guest Randy Pitchford.

article.title: Replay – Duke Nukem 3D (Guest: Randy Pitchford)
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: Randy Pitchford did what many thought to be impossible by making a Duke Nukem Forever release a reality, but his history with the series goes back much further than 2011. Before Borderlands, before Brothers in Arms, and before Gearbox even existed, he put in time at 3D Realms working on Duke Nukem 3D. He was recently at the Game Informer office, and was kind enough to sit in on a Replay of Duke's most famous title.
Watch below as Randy schools myself and Reiner on the various secrets and assorted trivia of Duke Nukem 3D.

description: QuackShot is the title game for the fifty-seventh episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is The Berenstain Bears' Camping Adventure.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Quackshot
article.author: Tim Turi
content: The Sega Genesis really hit full stride in the 90s with a handful of amazing Disney games. Among all those amazing Mickey games and excellent licensed Aladdin and Lion King games, there was the stellar adventure of Donald Duck doing his best Indiana Jones impression. Join three of the biggest (read: only) Quackshot fans in the Game Informer office as we plunger-gun our way through Duckberg, Mexico, and Transylvania in this under-appreciated gem.

In case you're wondering who the last crusaders of Quackshot are, it's Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and myself. In this episode we rediscover Donald's unconventional but useful firearm, zip across the roofs of Duckberg, and tip-toe through a strangely spooky stealth segment.

description: Ape Escape is the title game of the fifty-sixth episode of Replay. It was posted to the Game Informer website on February 12, 2011.

This episode is hosted by Tim Turi (on controls) and features Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner. The Replay Roulette is Martian Gothic: Unification, the last of four nominations for a future Super Replay after Countdown Vampires (Replay 53), Dracula: The Resurrection (Replay 54), and Galerians (Replay 55). After the Game Informer community voted, Galerians became Super Replay 7. Martian Gothic received about 20% of the vote.
notes: Reiner talks about his Star Wars themed wedding, complete with lightsabers and a Death Star cake. His wife (also a Star Wars fan) organized it as a surprise to him.
quotes: Ape Escape:
Dan: "Monkey in the Water is my favorite Elton John album... That's an obscure Elton John reference, no one's gonna get that."
Tim: "Have you read Monkey Profiles? It's a really... It's a– uh, Chuck Palahniuk book. Really, really, really disturbing. Monkey Profiles."
credit_cookie: Audio clip of Tim's (erotic?) Mario emotes from earlier in the Replay plays over a picture of a frightening, ultra-realistic Mario head.

gallery.title: Ape Escape - realistic Mario head.jpg (133 KB)

article.title: Replay – Ape Escape
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Long ago, in a time before every game was developed with dual analog sticks in mind, there was Ape Escape. This innovative game tasked players with capturing a tremendous amount of escaped, mischief-making monkeys, using one analog stick to control the hero and the other to swing an ape net. This old gem planted the seed for a fun series, and secured a place in the memories of those who played it at its prime.

Join Andrew Reiner, Dan Ryckert, and myself as we embark on a quest to reclaim as many apes as an episode of Replay allows. Along our journey we learn what monkey's like to do in their free time, discover the true meaning of swimming, and discuss how the game stacks up to today's titles.

Note: Remember to stick around for the roulette, which will be another Super Replay candidate for our spiritual successor to Overblood. Then be sure to come back on Monday when we will post a highlight reel and poll which will help you decide what game we play for an upcoming Super Replay. So far we've checked out Countdown: Vampires, Dracula: The Resurrection, and Galerians. What does this week have in store? Find out!

description: NARC is the title game of the fifty-fifth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette is Galerians, which eventually got its own Super Replay.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Tim Turi and Andrew Reiner. Dan and Tim play the featured game while Tim plays the Roulette.
notes: Galerians was a Super Replay candidate alongside three other Roulettes: Countdown Vampires (Replay 53), Dracula: The Resurrection (Replay 54), and Martian Gothic: Unification (Replay 56). Galerians ended up getting enough votes from the Game Informer community to become Super Replay 7.
The version of NARC used for this Replay is part of the Midway Arcade Treasures 2 compilation.
quotes: NARC:
Tim: "Just every lane, dumpster to dumpster traffic."
Dan: "Oh okay, the clown is pulling the hooker into– oh boy."
Dan: "Just killing clowns, hookers, and dogs that turn into tiny dogs."
Galerians:
Dan: "Every day I get home from work, and I just bang on my door for 30 minutes until... my landlord has to remind me to turn the handle."
credit_cookie: Dan beats Tim in a game of Mortal Kombat II from the Midway Arcade Treasures 2 disk. Then, gameplay from NARC of Mr. Big laughing and chasing the player character is shown while the ending theme song plays in the background.

article.title: Replay – NARC
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: I'm not much of a political man, but I think the greatest thing to come out of Ronald Reagan's presidency has to be his "Just Say No" anti-drug campaign. I doubt it was very effective, but all I care about is the fact that it helped spawn NARC. If you haven't played it, NARC is a game about crashing sports cars into the ghetto and shooting hobos with rocket launchers. While I may have been four years old when it came out (significantly before my employment at Game Informer), I would have had no issues giving this game a perfect 10 back in 1988. Then again, that might be why we don't have any four year-olds on staff.
If you can't tell by my enthusiasm, this game is awesome. Watch below as we plow through the classic quarter muncher.

description: Grand Theft Auto 2 is the title game of the fifty-fourth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette is Dracula: The Resurrection.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Tim Turi and Andrew Reiner. Dan plays the featured game while Tim plays the Roulette.
notes: Dracula: The Resurrection was a Super Replay candidate alongside three other Roulettes: Countdown Vampires (Replay 53), Galerians (Replay 55), and Martian Gothic: Unification (Replay 56). After the Game Informer community voted, Galerians became Super Replay 7.
quotes: Grand Theft Auto 2:
Tim: "Radio jokes, now in 3D!"
Dracula: The Resurrection:
Tim: "I was putting coins in Dan's butt."
Tim: (to viewers) "Oh, in case you don't know: Ben Reeves is dumb. Now you're up to speed."
credit_cookie: Tim makes turkey sounds (in time with the background music?) while Dan inputs the cheat codes for GTA2; Tim and Dan make noises.

article.title: Replay – Grand Theft Auto 2
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: If you're on this site, you know what Grand Theft Auto is. While we're willing to bet you're familiar with GTA III and IV, there's a chance some of you out there aren't nearly as familiar with the original top-down games. It's true that the jump to 3D did wonders for Rockstar's series, but you'll find much of the same personality and humor in their less visually-impressive earlier installments.
Check out our look back at GTA 2 below.

description: Resident Evil Survivor is the title game of the fifty-third episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette is Countdown Vampires.
This episode is hosted by Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner. Tim plays the featured game and Roulette.
notes: Countdown Vampires was a Super Replay candidate alongside three other Roulettes: Dracula: The Resurrection (Replay 54), Galerians (Replay 55), and Martian Gothic: Unification (Replay 56). After the Game Informer community voted, Galerians became Super Replay 7.
quotes: Resident Evil Survivor:
Tim: "Ostrich Beer? I want an Ostrich Beer!"
credit_cookie: Clips from RES emphasizing the iffy sound effects and voice acting.

article.title: Replay – Resident Evil Survivor
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Resident Evil is one of my favorite series of all time, but even this stellar series is not without its black sheep. Rotten, undead black sheep. One particularly sour title is Resident Evil: Survivor, a lightgun game for the original PlayStation... without lightgun support. The result is an awkward FPS survival horror game. Back in 2000 Resident Evil: Survivor received a 4/10 from Game Informer... but what do we think of it now?
Join Dan Ryckert, Andrew Reiner, and myself as we begin on a crash course through a zombie-infested town occupied by Umbrella.
A Special Note:

Did you like Super Replay: Overblood? Thought so. We did too, and the community response to the game has been phenomenal. We want you to take part in the selection process for an upcoming Super Replay of some old, crappy survival horror games. We kick off a series of four special Replays with this week's Replay Roulette, in which we select the first candidate for an Overblood successor. So what do you have to do? Simply watch all the Replay Roulettes over the next four weeks and choose your favorite potential Super Replay game. After we've sampled everything we'll post a poll where you can decide which crappy title we'll eventually have to play all the way through, purely for your enjoyment and our own sadomasochistic tendencies.
Enjoy!

description: Crash Bandicoot is the title game for the fifty-second episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Jackie Chan: Stuntmaster.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Tim Turi, Jeff Cork and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Crash Bandicoot
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: In the mid-90s, Nintendo had the iconic Mario and Sega had a not-quite-tarnished Sonic the Hedgehog. When Sony broke into the home console market with the original Playstation, they wanted a piece of that platforming mascot action. Enter Crash Bandicoot, an orange, spinning marsupial. He may not have set the world on fire when you look at his long-term history, but the original Naughty Dog titles were a lot of fun back in the day. We wanted to see how the original game held up in 2011, so it's this week's episode of Replay.

description: Red Dead Revolver is the name of the 51st episode of Replay. It was posted to the Game Informer website on January 8, 2011.
The episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Andrew Reiner and Phil Kollar.

Aside from stating this game was the spiritual inspriation for the later Rockstar game, Red Dead Redemption, the gang actually doesn't talk much about the title and instead focuses on Dan saying comical things.

Dan approached the game believing he had never played it before and was excited to see what had inspired one of his favorite games in the form of Red Dead Redemption. However, not 15 seconds into the first level, Dan realizes he HAS played the game before, though not much of it. He then remembers that maybe it was the western shooter, Gun, that he didn't play very much of either. But as Dan recalls the boss fight he was in that made him quit playing, he's told by Reiner that the fight Dan was describing, was indeed the final boss, and Dan had incidentally quit the game, right before beating it.
The only time the gang really focuses on the game itself is when Dan starts kicking guys in the "nuts," foreshadowing the Half-life Super Replay,
The Replay Roulette for this episode is BMX XXX.

article.title: Replay – Red Dead Revolver
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: While Rockstar San Diego's amazing Red Dead Redemption isn't exactly a sequel, it's a spiritual successor to 2004's Red Dead Revolver. Originally developed by Capcom, Rockstar took the reins and made some alterations to it before its eventual release. Considering our memories of Revolver aren't exactly fresh, we were curious to find out how it has held up over the years.
Make sure to stay tuned for our Roulette game. As you can see from the age gate, things took a surprisingly M-rated turn at some point and didn't go back.
Make sure to catch up on past Replays at our hub.

description: Altered Beast is the title game for the fiftieth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Garfield: Caught in the Act.
The host for this episode is Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Altered Beast
article.author: Tim Turi
content: What better way to ring in the new year than a Replay of a Genesis classic? Sega boasted that their 16-bit system could capture the sheer arcade might of this mythological side-scrolling brawler. This short but tough game allowed players to transform into werewolves and lizardmen, and it's still cool as hell. Can we beat it in one sitting?

Join Dan Ryckert and I at the controls with Andrew Reiner adding in some colorful commentary on the memorable cartridge. This video contains interesting insight, close calls, a miraculous realization, and a weird joke involving Robert Carlyle and Patrick Stewart.
Check out all our other Replays at our hub.

description: Glover is the title game for the forty-ninth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Rocket: Robot on Wheels.
The host for this episode is Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert, Phil Kollar, and Annette Gonzalez.

article.title: Replay – Glover
article.author: Tim Turi
content: We've accrued a lot of Replay requests since we started the series almost a year ago. Many ask us to revisit classic games like Super Metroid or Mario 64, but sometimes fervent fans ask for something less revered...like Glover.

Join Dan Ryckert, Phil Kollar, Annette Gonzalez, and I as we take a look an early 3D platformer that presumably holds a special spot in the nostalgic hearts of gamers who didn't have better options in 1998.
Check out all our other Replays at our hub.

description: Conker's Bad Fur Day is the title game for the forty-eighth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Chameleon Twist.
The host of this episode is Tim Turi and features Dan Ryckert, Matt Helgeson, and Andrew Reiner.

article.title: Replay – Conker's Bad Fur Day
article.author: Tim Turi
content: After playing classics like Donkey Kong Country, GoldenEye 007, and Banjo Kazooie, I was prepared to follow Rare to the end. I bought 2001's Conker's Bad Fur Day for the Nintendo 64 on blind faith alone. I went in expecting another solid platforming experiences, which the developer was known for. What I got was a buffet of great gameplay, memorable characters, and hilariously crude humor that holds up to this day. Has any game before or after ever featured a gigantic singing, slinging pile of excrement?
Join Dan Ryckert,Matt Helgeson, Andrew Reiner, and I as we revisit this N64 classic. Come for the singing poop, stick around for the engaging discussion regarding the Matrix universe.
Make sure to catch up on past Replays at our hub.

description: Crystal's Pony Tale is the title game of the forty-seventh episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette is Shaq-Fu.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Andrew Reiner, Tim Turi, and Jeff Cork. Tim plays the main game and Jeff, Tim, and Dan play the Roulette.
notes: Crystal's Pony Tale is so short that Tim was able to complete it during this episode, making this an unofficial Super Replay.
Crystal's Pony Tale was still sealed in its original shrink wrap when Dan pulled it out of the Vault for this Replay.

Dan: "It's a D-pad item that unlocks your ghost pony."

Tim: "Why'd they make this game?"

article.title: Replay – Crystal's Pony Tale
article.author: Ben Hanson
content: You've all been asking for it, so Game Informer is proud to present a replay of Crystal's Pony Tale. Will this pretty pony whinny its way to victory? Gallop alongside Andrew Reiner, Jeff Cork, Dan Ryckert, and Tim Turi as they take the reins and journey through the wondrous lands of this criminally overlooked Genesis gem. This is a good episode, trust me.

description: Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! is the title game of the forty-sixth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette is Amagon.
This episode is hosted by Dan Ryckert and features Andrew Reiner, Joe Juba, and Bryan Vore. All four play the main game while Dan plays the Roulette.
notes: Dan was so invested in Punch-Out!! that he was unable to refrain from twitching while playing and watching others play. This amused Reiner so much that he had a camera brought into the Replay room to catch it on video.
Dan considers Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! one of his ten favorite games of all time, and says it may be his favorite NES game.

Reiner's poll of the GI staff found that only six of them claim to have defeated Mike Tyson: Reiner, Andy McNamara, Jeff Cork, Matt Miller, Matt Bertz, and Jeff Akervik. On the January 26, 2012 episode of The Game Informer Show, Joe and Dan noted that they still have not defeated Tyson.

Dan: "This really is just as intense as, like, when I played it when I was ten."
Reiner: "I'm physically exhausted from laughing."
Dan: "I am sweating, by the way."
Amagon:
Dan: "I'm just punching these birds and snakes in the face and walking like the coolest guy that's ever lived."
credit_cookie: Dan claims that pressing Start and Select in between rounds of Punch Out!! means more health; Dan says, "If I was a boxer, I would think it would be, like, a bad idea to, like, raise my eyebrows before I punched someone every time."

article.title: Replay – Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!!
article.author: Dan Ryckert
content: It sounds absurd that a boxing game is considered one of the all-time greatest NES games considering its competition on the system, but Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! deserves its place in gaming history. While other boxing titles would allow you to mash buttons until your opponent fell to the canvas, Punch-Out required immaculate timing and memorization skills. In this manner, it was almost like a series of difficult boss fights that led up to the most difficult of all...Iron Mike.
Watch below as Andrew Reiner, Bryan Vore, Joe Juba, and myself take Little Mac up the ranks towards the Baddest Man on the Planet. How will we fare against the legend?
NOTE: Hearing some comments about the video freezing around the Don Flamenco fight. If this happens, try clearing your cache and reloading the page.

description: Super Star Wars is the title game for the forty-fifth episode of Replay. The Replay Roulette for this episode is Maui Mallard in Cold Shadow.
The host of this episode is Tim Turi and features Jeff Cork, Ben Reeves, and Andrew Reiner.
quotes: Tim "I just don't remember those scorpions from the movie"
Jeff "Why are you shooting from the landspeeder?"

Tim "How did you last so long?" Jeff "Just think about baseball."
Maui Mallard in Cold Shadow:
Tim "Reiner seems to be farting himself up a giant organ."

article.title: Replay – Super Star Wars
article.author: Tim Turi
content: Long before Knights of the Old Republic, long before Battlefront, and long before Rogue Squadron, there was Super Star Wars. This first entry in the 2D Star Wars action titles on the SNES was a take no prisoners affair that liberally altered the events of the classic trilogy. Only pure fans with freshly washed Ewok bedsheets, a replica lightsaber at their side, and a well-worn Yoda plushie could possibly endure such punishing gameplay. Asking who is the biggest Star Wars fan in the Game Informer office is kind of like asking which prequel is the worst, but how long do we last with Super Star Wars?
UPDATE: Here's the link to the funny video we mention in the Replay

Join Jeff Cork, Ben Reeves, Andrew Reiner, and myself as we voyage from Tatooine (so much Tatooine!) to the Death Star. We encounter tons of recognizable foes, and even more menaces that never graced the films. Why do sarlacs change so much, and since when are Jawas so aggressive? Thankfully, we've got a set of trusty codes to keep things moving this time as we marvel at this piece of 16-bit Star Wars history.
